div.p: A345 Royal Park Zoological Society letter & minute book, p. 50, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

At a meeting held yesterday, the trustees of the Royal Park were informed, that by fencing the additional piece of land, proposed to be added to the Brunswick Cricket Ground, an encroachment will take on an existing road, and the trustees have directed me to state to the Brunswick Council, that the concession made for the extension of the Cricket ground was herewith revoked, if any portion of the road was to be encroached on, and that (would)
The brackets and a small question-mark beneath this word suggest a query by the clerk who wrote out the file copy. under such circumstances it would be necessary for the Council to come to some arrangement with the trustees for a readjustment of the intended new line of the cricket ground.
I may add that on the small sketch plan, submitted by you, no indication of an interference with the existing road is indicated.
